meanings.definition: The quality or state of being weak or timid.
meanings.sent1: Her wimpiness showed when she refused to stand up for herself.
meanings.sent2: His wimpiness was evident when he avoided any confrontation.
meanings.sent3: Despite her wimpiness, she managed to muster the courage to speak up in the meeting.
meanings.sent4: The wimpiness of the kitten made it hesitant to explore beyond its bed.
meanings.sent5: The wimpiness of the old bridge was evident as it trembled under the weight of the passing cars.

meanings.definition: Behavior or attitude characterized by lack of courage or determination.
meanings.sent1: The team's wimpiness cost them the championship title.
meanings.sent2: His wimpiness in the face of challenges held him back from reaching his full potential.
meanings.sent3: Despite his wimpiness, he tried to muster the courage to jump off the diving board.
meanings.sent4: The wimpiness of the plant was evident as it wilted at the first sign of drought.
meanings.sent5: The wimpiness of the character made the audience root for their transformation throughout the story.
